conclusion: Understanding shadow changes involves considering shadow properties and formation.
Shadows are formed when an object blocks part of the light source, influenced by object shape and light source position.
As the light source moves backward, the shadow will move forward.
The size of the shadow will increase as the light source moves backward.
Shadow A will move forward and become larger when the light source moves backward.
Shadow B will move forward and become larger when the light source moves backward.
Shadow C will move forward and become larger when the light source moves backward.
Shadow D will move forward and become larger when the light source moves backward.
All shadows (A, B, C, and D) will move forward and become larger.
